One day, an elephant went to play. The elephant saw a fragile toy. The toy was pretty. The elephant wanted to play with the toy. But the elephant knew it was big and strong. The toy was small and weak.
The elephant did not want to break the toy. It wanted to play with it. The elephant thought for a moment. It had an idea. The elephant went to find a friend. The friend was a tiny ant.

One sunny day, Lily went to the garden and saw that the lemon tree had grown many big, yellow lemons! She ran to her mom and said, "Mom, our prayers worked! We have so many lemons now!"
Lily and her mom picked the lemons and made yummy lemonade. They were very happy and thanked the tree for the lemons. From that day on, Lily knew that praying could make good things happen.

! You are a bad friend! Go away, go away!" Sara yelled.
Tom felt scared and sorry. He did not mean to hurt Sara. He only wanted the patch. He tried to give it back to Sara, but she pushed him away. She ran into the house and slammed the door. Tom was left alone in the garden, holding the patch. He felt very sad and lonely. He wished he had not been so greedy. He wished he had been a better friend. He wished he could say sorry to Sara. But it was too late. Sara did not want to play with him anymore.

Mia said, "Mom, why did you add the mirror? It makes me sad."

Tom pedaled along the street, looking for people who wanted to buy his pastries. He saw a lady walking her dog. He stopped and said, "Hello, do you want to buy some pastries? They are very yummy and fresh."
The lady smiled and said, "Sure, they look delicious. How much are they?"
Tom thought for a moment. He did not know how to count very well. He said, "One penny for each."
